287.16.text: One of the features, though, of disgust,

290.37.text: is not just its universality and its strength,

293.30.text: but the way that it works through association.

296.34.text: So when one disgusting thing touches a clean thing,

300.08.text: that clean thing becomes disgusting, not the other way around.

303.43.text: This makes it very useful as a strategy if you want to

306.64.text: convince somebody that an object or an individual

308.40.text: or an entire social group is disgusting and should be avoided.

326.09.text: all of those are imagined as tainted by the dirt of the body."

774.63.text: Okay. The fact that emotions influence our judgment

778.16.text: should come as no surprise. I mean,

780.04.text: that's part of how emotions work.

781.44.text: They not only motivate you to behave in certain ways,

783.01.text: but they change the way you think.
